page.title: 02Sewage works and surrounds.
page.content: Area to the North of the river Ribble. This area is mainly Farmland and Marshland reclaimed from Tidal Marshes. The farming is Dairy and sheep. The marshland contains a Sewage plant which decontaminates sewage from the surrounding areas of Penwortham, Freckleton and Leagate. The plant processes on average 26.25 million gallons of sewage per day with a maximum of 48 million gallons. The semi sewage water is pumped into the river Ribble whilst the sludge is concentrated. This solid waste is used as land infill along with household and industrial refuse. The main tipping area being 'Lagoons' on Freckleton Marsh. The area to the East- Clifton Marsh- is being prepared for future tipping. This area is expected to be in use for 25 years.
